author: Staff Reporter
text:
As per the electoral roll for 2016, there are 30,13,042 voters in the 13 constituencies of Vellore

Students taking out a rally to create awareness of voting in Vellore. —Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

Around 1,000 students participated in a rally to create awareness on elections and voting rights on Monday.

Collector R. Nanthagopal, who flagged off the rally, said that of the 3.83 crore voters registered recently in the country, more than 1.1 crore were in the age group of 18 to 19 years.

This year, the Election Commission has put forth a theme – Inclusive and Qualitative Participation. Through such awareness initiative, the aim was to create awareness among young voters and enable them to participate in the voting process with enthusiasm, he added, according to a press release.

As per the electoral roll for 2016, there are 30,13,042 voters in the 13 assembly constituencies of Vellore district. Of this, 83,585 voters have been newly added. In this, 34,777 voters are aged 18 to 19 years, the collector said.

Mr. Nanthagopal urged the students to motivate those who have not enrolled in the list to get themselves registered.

Earlier, students and officials took the oath for the National Voters Day on the premises of DKM College for Women.
title: Students rally to create awareness of voting rights
